Class TutorialFlightBoard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.Flightboards.Flightboard
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.Flightboards.TutorialFlightBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class TutorialFlightBoard extends Flightboard
The TutorialFlightBoard class represents a specific implementation of a flightboard used in a tutorial game setting. It extends the base Flightboard class and provides customized logic for placing rockets at predefined starting positions and determining the order of rockets based on their positions. This class is designed to manage tutorial-specific rocket placement and ordering logic while leveraging the core functionality provided by the Flightboard base class.

  • Constructor Details

    • TutorialFlightBoard

      public TutorialFlightBoard(Game game)
      Constructs a new TutorialFlightBoard with a predefined board length of 18.
      Parameters:
      game - The Game object associated with this flight board, used to manage game-specific state and logic connected to the flight board.

    • TutorialFlightBoard

      public TutorialFlightBoard(List<String> orderedRockets, Map<String,Integer> positions, int flightBoardLength)
      Constructs a TutorialFlightBoard with the specified ordered list of rocket nicknames, a map of rocket positions, and the length of the flightboard.
      Parameters:
      orderedRockets - The ordered list of rocket nicknames representing their sequence on the tutorial flightboard.
      positions - The map containing the positions of rockets, where the key is the rocket's nickname and the value is its position.
      flightBoardLength - The length of the tutorial flightboard, representing the total number of valid positions.

  • Method Details

    • placeRocket

      public void placeRocket(String nickname, int pos)
      Places a rocket on the flightboard at the specified position based on the tutorial-specific starting position logic. This method maps the given position to a predefined flightboard index and updates the positions map and ordered rockets list.
      Specified by:
      placeRocket in class Flightboard
      Parameters:
      nickname - The unique nickname of the rocket being placed on the flightboard.
      pos - The position on the flightboard where the rocket is to be placed. Valid positions range from 0 to 3, corresponding to predefined starting positions. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the position is invalid.

    • getStartingPositions

      public List<Integer> getStartingPositions()
      Retrieves a list of predefined starting positions for rockets on the flightboard.
      Specified by:
      getStartingPositions in class Flightboard
      Returns:
      A list of integers representing the starting positions of rockets. These positions are fixed and ordered as defined by the tutorial-specific flightboard logic.
